intro: Crepis crocea subsp. dahurica, commonly known as the Siberian mouse-ear, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring dense, hairy foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and is often found in dry meadows and rocky soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger size and more robust growth compared to other Crepis species.
